medical_history.chief_complaint: Crampy epigastric abdominal pain radiating in a band-like distribution.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 3 AM and have continued for several hours. The pain is accompanied by nausea and non-bilious emesis. The patient took a PPI without relief and has been unable to keep down food or beverage. Bowel habits remain normal with no diarrhea or blood in stool.
medical_history.past_medical_history: GERD, multiple sclerosis, hypertension, previous C-section.
